Name: Block_Quotes
Chelsea: ['Ideally situated between numerous world-class contemporary art galleries and restaurants, Chelsea has a tremendous array of offerings. David Zwirner, Gagosian, Cheim & Reid, & Pace Gallery  are popular gallery destinations. For architecture enthusiasts, West Chelsea along the High Line offers a virtual panorama of contemporary architecture from the likes of Frank Gehry, Jean Nouvel, and Neil Denari.', 'The location is unbeatable as you are a few blocks to Madison Square Park, EATALY, The FlatIron Building, Whole Foods Market and all of the great bars, clubs and restaurants that Chelsea has to offer. Times Square, Union Square, Central Park, the East Village, the West Village and Soho are all a very short taxi or subway ride away.']

Name: Lede
Chelsea: Uptown affluence and downtown style come together in Chelsea. Cutting-edge art galleries and gay-friendly bars mingle with sought-after high-rises and converted warehouses in this ultra-fashionable, and ultra busy, neighborhood. Chelseas world-class architecture, fine dining establishments, and hip nightlife scene contribute to its first-rate reputation.

Name: Intro
Chelsea: Make sure you step out in style when in this cutting-edge and quintessential NYC neighborhood.

Name: Photo_Captions
Chelsea: ['The concierge at the iconic Chelsea Hotel has welcomed countless writers, artists, and musicians, such as Allen Ginsberg, Leonard Cohen, and Janis Joplin.', 'Whether on two wheels or two feet, the residents of Chelsea are always in vogue.', 'Chelsea infuses its wide open spaces with a residential calm.', "The neighborhood's famous galleries range from high art to experimental works.", "The High Line, possibly New York's most beloved public space, connects Chelsea and the Meatpacking District.", "When walking along this abandoned freight line, in places it's easy to forget you are in the city.", "In other places, the High Line provides the best views of New York's stunning architecture."]
